file_content.text: Wait! There's no need for this, is there? We're all reasonable people.
Hold on there, Master Jedi. Put down the lightsaber and let's talk for a moment.
Hold your fire, soldier! Why don't we talk about this like civilized people?
Look, neither of us wants to get killed today, right? So why don't we talk this over.
Wait! Let's not do anything hasty. Put your weapon away, and we'll talk.
Nobody else in this place has wanted to stop and chat.
Why so civil?
My crew is a bit... overeager at times. I'll speak to them about it, I assure you. The survivors, anyway.
Speak quickly.
Very well, speak.
Master Jedi, you are wise, and generous and stylish and--well, I'll get to the point, shall I?
Start talking.
I would not presume to waste your time.
I don't buy it.
But I think you can trust implicitly that I don't wish to die.
I don't talk with pirates.
We have nothing to discuss.
"Pirate" is such a harsh word. I'm more of a salvager, saving these poor, lost ships. Putting wreckage to good use! Nothing wrong with that.
It so happens that I can give you what you came for without any more of that... unpleasant killing business.
You want the Republic's superweapon? Look around you. This hangar is filled with copies of it--one for every ship in our fleet.
You built copies of a Republic superweapon, and you think it's a good idea to admit it?
Why are you telling me this?
Now you know what you're bargaining for.
You copied the prototype?
The Republic doesn't have a monopoly on clever engineers.
That's very impressive, but it won't save your life.
So what?
I propose a trade: You leave here with the weapons, we leave here with our lives. That's fair, don't you think?
Let's talk details: How do we know you'll hand over all the weapons?
I'm open to discussing it.
We can arrange for--
That sounds reasonable.
My people will--
Reinforcements have arrived!
I see. Stalling until your people were ready to attack?
We can still negotiate. No one has to get hurt.
This isn't what it looks like.
Don't bother lying. I'm not a fool.
The situation was under control. You didn't have to barge in here.
Arim, your timing stinks.
Exactly. [Attack.]
Don't think we'll go quietly.
I have a better idea: I take all the weapons and put a stop to you pirates at the same time.
No deal. [Attack.]
You'll regret this!
